2:
I will be glad and rejoice in you;
\q I will sing praise to your name, Most High!
3:
When my enemies turn back,
\q they stumble and perish before you.
\q
4:
For you have defended my just cause;
\q you sit on your throne, a righteous judge!
6:
The enemy crumbled like ruins
\q when you overthrew their cities.
\q All remembrance of them has perished.
8:
He will judge the world with righteousness,
\q and he will execute judgment for the nations with fairness.
9:
Yahweh also will be a stronghold for the oppressed,
\q a stronghold in times of trouble.
\q
10:
Those who know your name trust in you,
\q for you, Yahweh, do not abandon those who seek you.
12:
For the God who avenges bloodshed remembers;
\q he does not forget the cry of the oppressed.
13:
Have mercy on me, Yahweh; see how I am oppressed by those who hate me,
\q you who can snatch me from the gates of death.
\q
14:
Oh, that I might proclaim all your praise.
\q In the gates of the daughter of Zion
\q I will rejoice in your salvation!
17:
The wicked are turned back and sent to Sheol,
\q the destiny of all the nations that forget God.
\q
18:
For the needy will not always be forgotten,
\q nor will the hopes of the oppressed be forever dashed.
